answers.answer: You just might have a small baby that's all. Doesn't mean you're doing anything wrong!
Last 2 weeks she just gained 80 gr, should be around 200 gr normally.I will leave from the job and try to relax and rest.Hope will work, im sad and concern.

Did they say what's causing it? Just stress? Or is it maybe preeclampsia?I know it's scary. I delivered my girl at 35 weeks. She was only 4 pounds 7 ounces. It is crazy having a preemie, and a little scary, but it is also very precious time! Try not to be too scared and do take it easy! I will pray that you and baby will be just fine. :)

My blood pressure is on the limit im taking pills for that last one week.Tomorrow i will make a urine test we will see if there is a problem related with preeclempsia.How big is your baby girl now,is she doing well?
Does anyone got the same problem, help pleasee????

She is right on track now! And, when she was born, she didn't even have to do into the nicu! It is a little scary. But as long as there are no complications, having a preemie baby is such a precious thing. Knowing now that she did so fine, it's amazing to look at her pictures and see how small she was. Hope everything goes just as well for you guys!

I had a friend that had preclamsia (spelling) she delivered at 25 weeks and just last week on her actual due date they got discharged, it was and long road but she is doing great and  is 5 lbs. Your further along than she is and honestly I think u will be fine maybe a couple weeks in nicu and that's it. Don't stress momma it happens all the time and they are very well trained.

question: Im 33+6, today i have a scan baby size shows 32 weeks...doctor told me to leave my job, and i will receive 2 injections for babys lungs improvement, plus proteins helping the baby to grow.im taking care  doing everything for my baby and im very upset facing with this problem.
title: baby 2 weeks behind
